definition: (sports) overtime/extra time/play-off
abbr. for Canada 加拿大[Jia1 na2 da4]/surname Jia

to add/plus/(used after an adverb such as 不, 大, 稍 etc, and before a disyllabic verb, to indicate that the action of the verb is applied to sth or sb previously mentioned)/to apply (restrictions etc) to (sb)/to give (support, consideration etc) to (sth)
o'clock/time/when/hour/season/period
surname Shi
to compete/competition/match/to surpass/better than/superior to/to excel

sentences.english: The score is a draw, it's going to go into overtime.
sentences.chinese: 比分打平，比賽將進入加時賽。

sentences.english: They won the match after a sudden-death play-off.
sentences.chinese: 加時賽中以突然死亡法贏得了比賽。

sentences.english: Jamison didn't score in the overtime, missing all four of his shots.
sentences.chinese: 加時賽賈米森四投零中未得分。

sentences.english: The title was decided by a sudden-death play-off.
sentences.chinese: 冠軍是由突然死亡法的加時賽決定的。

sentences.english: They scored all 12 of Miami's points in overtime;
sentences.chinese: 他們包攬了加時賽中熱火的全部12分。

sentences.english: The match ended 1-1 after extra time.
His team lost the game after overtime and a shootout.
sentences.chinese: 經過加時賽和點球，他所在的隊伍輸了這次比賽。

sentences.english: A goal the U. S. team lost to Ghana, overtime, missed the South Africa World Cup quarterfinals.
sentences.chinese: 美國隊加時賽一球惜敗於加納，無緣南非世界盃八強。

definition: hat-trick (sports)
to attack (one another)
(idiom) to lose one's head/to panic/to go to pieces
to spike the ball (volleyball etc)/to smash (tennis etc)
party membership/membership card
lit. to drive a duck onto a perch (idiom)/fig. to push sb to do sth way beyond their ability
(coll.) lowest-ranking (student, participant etc)/to rank at the bottom of the list/to finish last
without a retreat route/caught in a dead end/having burned one's bridges
fake move or pass (sports)/feint
to open fire/to shoot a gun
half a life/only half alive/barely alive/(scared, beaten etc) half to death
to drown sb in a wicker basket, a form of 沉潭[chen2 tan2]
victory is in sight
defensive position/guard
lit. the river that divides Chu and Han/fig. a line that divides rival territories/the mid-line between sides on a Chinese chessboard
all crows are black (idiom)/evil people are bad all over the world
pinyin: tian1 xia4 wu1 ya1 yi1 ban1 hei1
